metadata.title: CVE-2017-9334 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An incorrect "pair?" check in the Scheme "length" procedure results in an unsafe pointer dereference in all CHICKEN Scheme versions prior to 4.13, which allows an attacker to cause a denial of service by passing an improper list to an application that calls "length" on it.

criterions.comment: chicken package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.12.0-0.3').
